item.title: 1-metre square section of the main carriageway, 10th October
item.description:
The tarmac has broken away, exposing uneven and loose aggregate. The depression within the square exceeds 5cm in places, creating a pothole-like cavity. During rainfall, the area retains water, obscuring the hazard and increasing the risk of loss of traction. The perimeter of the defect is actively deteriorating, suggesting progressive failure of the sounding surface. Individuals crossing or walking near the area may trip or fall, particularly those with mobility or visual impairment. Sudden impact with the cavity may result in damage, suspension issues, or loss of steering control. Given the location on the main road, any incident caused by this hazard could impede emergency vehicle access or response times. This road is a main thoroughfare for emergency vehicles and public transport.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish has been on the lane for several months, 10th October
item.description:
This rubbish has been here for several months, previous report of this was closed out as it had been investigated and cleared. The rubbish is still here and has not been touched. The location is approach from Old Maidstone Road, onto Cookham Road, about 400m down the track past the compost site entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cookham Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
